result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Douglas W.C. Skipper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Douglas W.C. Skipper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Douglas W.C. Skipper was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Douglas W.C. Skipper was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay fine of $250    and court costs including all applicable surcharges.   Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100 ea applicable count).   
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1046.92  plus surcharges.   
Review hearing on 4-1-16 @ 8:45.  
The Court does not object to probation being transferred to Illinois.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:58am-  State has filed a motion to revoke the DPA.  DE objects.  Discussion held.  Court orders parties to put any stipulations into writing.  Motion hearing adjourned to November 9, 2015 at 09:30 am for arguments.  Bond continued.
to Revoke Stipulated Hold Open Agreement - filed by ADA Jason Zapf     (8/18/2015 at 8:45am)
Cts 1 & 2
Ct. 4

Defendant, Douglas W.C. Skipper, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Victim in court, provided a statement. Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1: D.C., Dom Abuse, Ct 2: Battery, Dom Abuse, Ct 3: Strangulation & Suffocation, Domestic Abuse; found guilty by the court. Judgment withheld on Ct 3. If hold open is completed, State will dismiss Ct 3. Ct 4 dismissed on ST's motion. Amended Hold Open Agreement filed today and is the agreement used for plea/sentencing. Discussion held on DE's possession of firearms and residency/transfer of probation to the State of Illinois. 
SENTENCE: Cts 1 & 2: Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for one (1) year w/conditions; counts to run concurrent to each other. 2 days sentence credit if revoked. Court costs ordered. Restitution stipulated to in the amount of $1,046.92 to be paid during the course of the Hold Open Agreement, order signed in court. Firearms Warning given. Appeal rights given.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Deferred prosecution agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:11am-  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved by a hold open agreement.  Court inquires as to the status of the alleged victim's requests in previous letter addressed.  Attorney Watson advises the court that the DE's friend attempt to obtain his belongings & the alleged victim denied the DE's friend but his address has been changed with his employer.  Court adjourns matter to allow Attorney Watson to follow up on the alleged victim's requests.  Final pre-trial adjourned to February 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.
